goal: Build an anti-goal-drift workflow for Cursor using an MCP goal authority and enforced permits.
success_criteria: MCP server exposes tools: guardian_get_contract, guardian_initialize_contract, guardian_check_step, guardian_issue_permit, guardian_commit_result
Cursor hooks block shell and MCP calls without a valid permit token
Permits are short-lived and stored in .ai (gitignored) and cannot be read by the model
Clear README + example configs (.cursor/mcp.json and .cursor/hooks.json) are provided
constraints: No silent scope expansion: every step must map to explicit success criteria IDs.
Prefer deterministic enforcement via hooks over prompt-only guidance.
Never log to stdout inside the MCP server except JSON-RPC.
